intro: Cyrtandra poulsenii, commonly known as the Hawaiian cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its tubular, often brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an herb or shrub, with opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rainforest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
